P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the US House of Representatives passes a bill that significantly alters the United States' foreign policy towards Iran. P.title: Will Tesla's advancements in battery technology lead to a breakthrough in energy storage for scientific research by 2030?

P.title: Will any European Union regulation significantly impact the cryptocurrency market by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the European Union has enacted one or more regulations that significantly impact the cryptocurrency market. A regulation will be considered to have a significant impact if it meets any of the following criteria:
- It leads to a change of 10% or more in the total market capitalization of cryptocurrencies within a 30-day period following its announcement or implementation.
- It introduces new, mandatory compliance requirements for a majority of cryptocurrency exchanges operating within the EU, affecting their operations.
- It results in the banning or severe restriction of one or more major cryptocurrencies (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum) within the EU.
Significant impact will be determined based on reports from reputable financial news sources (e.g., Financial Times, Bloomberg, Reuters) and data from recognized cryptocurrency market analysis firms.

P.title: Will the Amazon rainforest's rate of deforestation decrease by 30% by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the rate of deforestation in the Amazon rainforest has decreased by at least 30% compared to the rate recorded in the year 2020.
The assessment of the deforestation rate will be based on data provided by the National Institute for Space Research (INPE) of Brazil, or any other authoritative source recognized by the international scientific community.

A "significant discovery" is defined as a development in robotics technology or application that leads to a breakthrough in understanding, methodology, or application in any field of the natural sciences (e.g., biology, chemistry, physics, earth science). The discovery must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, citation in multiple subsequent research works, or acknowledgment by a reputable scientific organization. The advancement must be directly attributable to the robotics discovery and represent a clear departure from existing capabilities or knowledge. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Discoveries that are primarily advancements in computer science or engineering without direct application to the natural sciences do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a breakthrough in aerospace engineering has led to a significant improvement in global pandemic response capabilities. P.title: Will the Amazon rainforest's rate of deforestation decrease by 30% by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the rate of deforestation in the Amazon rainforest has decreased by at least 30% compared to the rate recorded in the year 2020.
The assessment of the deforestation rate will be based on data provided by the National Institute for Space Research (INPE) of Brazil, or any other authoritative source recognized by the international scientific community.
In the event that INPE or equivalent authoritative data is not available for 2025, this question will resolve using the most recent data available from these sources prior to 2025.
For the purpose of this question, "deforestation" refers to the permanent removal of primary forest cover in the Amazon basin. Temporary changes in forest cover due to natural events (e.g., fires, floods) that are expected to recover naturally do not count towards the deforestation rate.

P.title: Will China lead the world in quantum computing research by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, China is recognized as the global leader in quantum computing research. Leadership in quantum computing research is defined by the following criteria:

- Publication Volume: China must have the highest number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in the field of quantum computing, compared to any other country.

- Technological Breakthroughs: China must have achieved at least one major technological breakthrough in quantum computing that is recognized by the international scientific community.

Recognition of China's leadership position must be confirmed by at least two of the following authoritative sources: Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum, or the annual reports of the National Quantum Initiative or the European Quantum Flagship program.
